p: Milk catalase is a heme protein and molecular weight of catalase is 200 kDa with isoelectric pH of 5.5. This enzyme is stable in a wide range of pH 5–10 and however, it rapidly loses activity out this pH range [ 53]. Most of the catalases contain heme and catalase causes the dismutation of H 2O 2 (a chemical reaction in which H 2O 2 causes oxidation of the other H 2O 2 molecules, consequently, one is converted to O 2 and the other two are converted to tow molecules of H 2O) [ 54]. A polarographic method showed that average catalase activity in cow milk was 1.95 U/mL [ 55]. Concentration of catalase in human milk is approximately ten times greater than cow milk [ 56].
